formattedAddress: East 114th Street and the FDR Drive Thomas Jefferson Park, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: East 114th Street and the FDR Drive Thomas Jefferson Park, New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text: Memorial BBQ for my mom's 90 birthday. She passed in 2018. It was good to some family & friends in remembrance of her life & legacy. Park was full with people celebrating every event from birthday to baby shower and something in between. Towards end...a party a few feet from us did a fireworks display which was the perfect ending to beautiful day.

text.text: Memorial BBQ for my mom's 90 birthday. She passed in 2018. It was good to some family & friends in remembrance of her life & legacy. Park was full with people celebrating every event from birthday to baby shower and something in between. Towards end...a party a few feet from us did a fireworks display which was the perfect ending to beautiful day.

originalText.text:
My local.

Kickout: during the school year, the school next door will kick out everyone during recess, which starts at either 10 or 11 am (changes from year to year). Not sure when exactly it re-opens

No flat bar, so not good for beginner rail tricks, but the mini is ~3 feet and great for beginners and learning new tricks. Fun box is great, a few good hips, and people get really creative with the banks.

An enormous amount of flat ground all around, so perfect for beginners who want to get warmed up slow and then try something on a bank.

Not very much shade.

You just can’t help but wish they put a flat bar in the middle instead of a dead cobblestone zone.

Also, fair warning that it’s painted, and constantly re-painted because of locals covering up tags. Especially the mini. So don’t expect to slide all over the place.

Worth noting the 5 stair is pretty long, but you can just go off the back like a loading dock. Hand rails start low and get sack-able.

originalText.text: Maintained well. Very clean park. I gave my foster dog the experience of feeling wild running free, jumping up and down on their obstacle court. Loved that I could close the gate for her to have a half an hour experience.

text.text: Maintained well. Very clean park. I gave my foster dog the experience of feeling wild running free, jumping up and down on their obstacle court. Loved that I could close the gate for her to have a half an hour experience.

originalText.text: Nice park . The track isn't .25 miles though. I think a lap and a 1/4 is.. so to make one mile you would have to do 5 laps. Which is 4 laps on an official size track.

text.text: Nice park . The track isn't .25 miles though. I think a lap and a 1/4 is.. so to make one mile you would have to do 5 laps. Which is 4 laps on an official size track.

originalText.text:
This is the skate park everyone wishes was in their neighborhood. Nothing too big, metal edges on everything. Mini ramp always makes things better. I think this was the first NYC skatepark to experiment with the idea of having the mini ramp be somewhat in the park and not by itself...the low curb on the western deck of the mini ramp is awesome. Would love to see that in more parks. More experienced skaters will have fun here 8 days a week, while a beginner can come to this park and leave feeling like they accomplished something. Lots of smooth pavement on the outside of the park if flat ground is your thing.

I was here once in the summer and parking can be difficult. In the winter it was no problem at all.
